home.name: Small and Green
home.desc: UNIDO-GEF Project on Upgrading of China Small Hydropower Capacity

projOverview.name: Project Overview
projOverview.desc: The Project on Upgrading of China Small Hydropower Capacity is joinlty implemented by UNIDO, MOF, MWR and ICSHP. Funded by the Global Environment Facility (GEF), the Project leveraged funding from the rural hydropower (SHP) efficiency and expansion programme under China's 13th FYP, aiming at benefits in river ecosystem restoration, SHP safety, and automated operation. By adding these values to the Chinese programme, the Project contributes to the sustainability and quality development of the industry. Launched in 2017, the Project has carried out 19 demonstration projects in 8 provinces, showcasing success stories of the environmental and social benefits of safe and green SHP. Meanwhile, the Project has helped improve China's SHP policies and build professional capacity, which are meaningful for better utilization of this sustainable energy. The Project contributes to China's energy transition and accumulates experiences for global SHP development. Its outputs mainly include technical and financial feasibilities, policy and institutions, and capacity building and knowledge sharing.
projOverview.richDesc:
The Project on Upgrading of China Small Hydropower Capacity is joinlty implemented by UNIDO, MOF, MWR and ICSHP. Funded by the Global Environment Facility (GEF), the Project leveraged funding from the rural hydropower (SHP) efficiency and expansion programme under China's 13th FYP, aiming at benefits in river ecosystem restoration, SHP safety, and automated operation. By adding these values to the Chinese programme, the Project contributes to the sustainability and quality development of the industry.

Launched in 2017, the Project has carried out 19 demonstration projects in 8 provinces, showcasing success stories of the environmental and social benefits of safe and green SHP. Meanwhile, the Project has helped improve China's SHP policies and build professional capacity, which are meaningful for better utilization of this sustainable energy. The Project contributes to China's energy transition and accumulates experiences for global SHP development. Its outputs mainly include:

  • Technical and financial feasibilities
  • Policy and institutions
  • Capacity building and knowledge sharing

demoPlants.name: Pilot Plants
demoPlants.desc: 26 SHP plants across 8 Chinese provinces underwent refurbishment and upgrades as technical demonstration

children.name: Maoyandong II
children.desc: Maoyandong II SHP is located in Yongning, Luxi, Yunnan. It was first commissioned in December 1988 in a canal-penstock scheme.

children.name: Mabozi
children.desc: Mabozi SHP is located in Gaoda Villege, Tonghai, Yuxi, Yunnan. First commissioned in May 1981, it is in a barrage layout.

children.name: Chahe
children.desc: Chahe SHP sits in Gebaikong Village, Baoxiu Town, Shiping, Yunnan. The plant is in a canal-penstock layout without storage capacity. It was first commissioned in 1988.

children.name: Zhoujialiang
children.desc: Zhoujiang SHP is located in Jiangwan Village, Yunyang, Shiyan, Hubei. It was first commissioned in 1986 in a canal-penstock layout.

children.name: Yangdaohe
children.desc: Yangdaohe SHP is located in Xiakou, Xingshan, Yichang, Hubei. It was first commissioned in July 1997 in a canal-penstock layout.

children.name: Chaotianhou
children.desc: Chaotianhou SHP is located in Xiakou, Xingshan, Yichang, Hubei. It was first commissioned in April 1999 in a canal-penstock layout.

children.name: Shijiaba

children.name: Jiangjunzhu

children.name: Majing

children.name: Gaokeng

children.name: Tangban
children.desc: Tangban SHP is located in Pandu, Lianjiang, Fujian on the Aojiang River. It was first commissioned in 2000 in a barrage scheme.

children.name: Jiaosan
children.desc: Jiaosan SHP is located in Dalong, Taining, Fujian. It was first commissioned in 1997 in a barrage scheme.

children.name: Tantou
children.desc: Tantou SHP is located in Dalong, Taining, Fujian. The plant is in a canal-penstock scheme, and was first commissioned in 1994.

children.name: Gaofang II
children.desc: Gaofang II SHP is located in northeast Pucheng, Nanping, Fujian. The plant was first commissioned in 1998 in a canal-penstock layout.

children.name: Xinpingya

children.name: Gaunxi

children.name: Sandieling
children.desc: Sandieling SHP is located in Hurun, Jingxi, Baise, Guangxi. It is a canal-penstock plant first commissioned in 1996.

children.desc: Dongpai SHP is located in Hurun, Jingxi, Baise, Guangxi. It is a canal-penstock plant first commissioned in 1999.

children.name: Aibu II

children.name: Qingshuitan

children.name: Panxi II

techDemo.name: Technical Demonstration
techDemo.desc: Technical demonstration through upgrades and refurbishment of SHP plants showcases the technical and economic feasibilities of green SHP development. These studies and analysis capture the changes, costs and benefits, social-environmental impacts and future scenarios under climate change.

children.name: Ex-Ante & Ex-Post Analysis
children.desc: Ten pilot plants were studied to compare the environmental, social, economic situations before and after the refurbishment and therefore find changes and problems.

children.name: Cost Benefit Analysis
children.desc: Four pilot plants were studied to quantitatively analyse the costs and (social, economic & environmental) benefits in monetary terms.

children.name: ESMP Implementation
children.desc: All plants were monitored and analysed for their implementation of ESMPs made before the start of their refurbishment.

children.name: Hydrological Regime Analysis
children.desc: Four pilot plants were studied to analyse their power outputs in future scenarios with their hydrological regimes under climate impacts.

instlOutputs.name: Policy Outputs
instlOutputs.desc: Outputs from the UNIDO-GEF project contribute to China's SHP institutions, including technical standards, incentive policies and regulatory frameworks.

children.name: Technical Standards & Policies
children.desc: Outputs in technical standards and policies

children.name: Green SHP Assessment Standard
children.desc: This industrial standard lays out detailed requirements for green SHP certification, including those for its methodology and operation. It is the first-ever standard for green hydropower development in China. It is has an index number as SL/T752-2020.

children.name: Technical Guidelines for contril of flow reduction downstream of SHP stations
children.desc: This industrial standard addresses the need of measures to recover depleted river sections downstream SHP plants, including principal requirements and technical methodologies for these measures. It is a comprehensive package of technical measures and managerial practices. It is has an index number as SL/T796-2020.

children.name: Technical Guidelines for green SHP certification
children.desc: This document is a manual for the certification of green SHP, including technical interpretations, key operational aspects, tutorials for the use of online management system, and case studies.

children.name: Green SHP development strategy and proposal
children.desc: Through studies of green SHP policies, technical measures, and managerial practices, this puts forward objectives, implementation plans and overal strategy that China's green SHP development could use.

children.name: China Green SHP Online Management System
children.desc: The system was improved under this UNIDO-GEF project based on extensive consultation of stakeholders.

children.name: Best practice manual in SHP operational safety
children.desc: This manual is based on case studies of 12 SHP plants among those with highest safety accreditations, highlighting their experiences in improving operational safety.

children.name: Incentive Policies
children.desc: Recommendations in incentive policies for green SHP

children.name: Recommendation on green SHP labelling
children.desc: This study is based on extensive studies of international and domestic experiences in labelling systems to come up with recommendations on labelling schemes of green SHP in China.

children.name: Recommendations on local incentive policies
children.desc: This study combs through international and domestic experiences in incentive policies in green SHP development, and makes reccommendations on proliferating incentive policies at local government level.

children.name: Recommendations on local incentive policies
children.desc: This study draws upon international and domestic experiences in green SHP development, and makes reccomendations on national incentive policies for green SHP development.

CapAndKno.name: Capacity and Knowledge
CapAndKno.desc: Extensive capacity building and knowledge sharing events have been organised under this UNIDO-GEF project.

children.name: Seminars
children.desc: 项目2022-2023年组织了3次国内研讨会（西安、南昌、昆明）和1次国际研讨会（北京，线上），在国内外深入分享项目执行取得的经验和知识。

children.name: 南昌研讨会
children.desc: 2022年11月，江西南昌，项目研讨会小水电绿色发展论坛作为第十七届中国（国际）水务高峰论坛系列活动之一举办。

children.name: 南昌研讨会
children.desc: 2022年11月，江西南昌，中国水力发电工程学会原副秘书长张博庭在项目研讨会作报告。

children.name: 南昌研讨会
children.desc: 2022年11月，江西南昌，水利部国际小水电中心主任岳梦华副主任在项目研讨会作报告。

children.name: 昆明研讨会
children.desc: 2023年4月，云南昆明，中国工程院院士马洪琪在项目研讨会做报告。

children.name: 昆明研讨会
children.desc: 2023年4月，云南昆明，行业专家在项目研讨会就小水电绿色发展机制展开讨论。

children.name: 西安研讨会
children.desc: 2022年8月，陕西西安，项目研讨会双碳目标下的小水电高质量发展论坛举办。

children.name: 培训班
children.desc: 2020至2022年，项目累计开展了17期小水电行业能力建设培训班，为小水电业主、技术人员、政府官员等增强从业能力，服务行业绿色转型发展。

children.name: 南京培训班
children.desc: 2020年9月，江苏南京，针对小水电业主、开发和技术人员能力建设的第一期培训班举办。

children.name: 杭州培训班
children.desc: 2020年9月，浙江杭州，针对小水电业主、开发和技术人员能力建设的第二期培训班举办。

children.name: 海口培训班
children.desc: 2020年12月，海南海口，针对绿色小水电站创建的第二期专项培训班举办。

children.name: 海口培训班
children.desc: 2020年12月，浙江杭州，针对安全生产标准化建设的第一期专项培训班举办。

children.name: 丽水培训班
children.desc: 2022年1月，浙江丽水，针对小水电业主、开发和技术人员能力建设的第五期培训班举办。

children.name: 杭州培训班
children.desc: 2022年8月，浙江杭州，针对绿色小水电站创建的第四期专项培训班举办。

children.name: Technical tours
children.desc: 2019年，结合能力建设培训班内容，项目分别组织相关小水电业主、政府官员，赴美国、奥地利、瑞士进行技术考察，学习相关知识和经验。

children.name: 业主代表团
children.desc: 2019年6月，美国麻省大学洛威尔分校，项目组织的小水电从业者代表团参加由美国低影响水电协会LIHI举办的研讨会。

children.name: 业主代表团
children.desc: 2019年6月，美国马萨诸塞州洛威尔市，代表团参观Lowell水电站，电站总装机22.6MW，于2017获得LIHI认证。

children.name: 业主代表团
children.desc: 2019年6月，美国马萨诸塞州洛威尔市，代表团参观位于洛威尔市的Lowell水电站的垂直槽鱼梯。

children.name: 官员代表团
children.desc: 2019年11月，奥地利维也纳，项目组织小水电官员代表团访问UNIDO总部，UNIDO执行干事Philippe Scholtes先生向代表团致欢迎词。

children.name: 官员代表团
children.desc: 2019年11月，奥地利维也纳，代表团参观多瑙河Freudenau水电站，电站建于1998年，总装机172MW。

children.name: 官员代表团
children.desc: 2019年11月，瑞士伯尔尼，代表团参观瑞士KWO水电公司，电站装机250MW，获得瑞士Naturemade Star认证。

children.name: Technical support
children.desc: 除试点电站外，项目还向小水电站提供技术支持，帮助完成绿色小水电示范电站创建和安全生产标准化达标各24座。

children.name: 技术支持
children.desc: 浙江二滩坝水电站，装机2,520KW，2021年创建成为绿色小水电示范电站。

children.name: 技术支持
children.desc: 浙江丰潭水电站，装机14,000KW，2021年创建成为绿色小水电示范电站。

children.name: 技术支持
children.desc: 浙江铜山源水电站，装机4,800KW，2021年创建成为绿色小水电示范电站。

children.name: 技术支持
children.desc: 湖北古洞口水电站，装机49,800KW，2022年达成安全生产标准化一级。

children.name: 技术支持
children.desc: 湖南欧阳海水电站，装机42,600KW，2022年达成安全生产标准化一级。

children.name: 技术支持
children.desc: 广东黄龙带水库一级电站，装机2,400KW，2022年达成安全生产标准化一级。

projectStats.name: Project Stats
projectStats.desc: Key statistics about the UNIDO-GEF Project

children.name: Annual outputs of pilot plants
children.desc: Annual outputs of pilot plants since 2010 (x10 MWh), which take evident dips when the plants underwent refurbishment and upgrades (mostly between 2017 and 2019) and recovers afterwards. Please see "Pilot Plants" and "Technical Demonstration" sections of the page. For clarity, only three plants are displayed by default. Please use the dropdown menu on the top-right of this figure to see more.

children.name: GHG Emission Cuts
children.desc: Greenhouse gas cuts (ton) because of the marginal increase in power output from the pilot plants after refurbishment compared to long-term average before. When output is below the long-term average before, no cut is accounted at that plant. Please see "Pilot Plants" and "Technical Demonstration" sections of the page for more details. Please select plants in the dropdown menu of the top-right of the figure.

children.name: Eployee Genders of Pilot Plants
children.desc: Genders of the employees of the pilot plants before and after the refurbishment. Data from monitoring and analysis (Zhejiang Univerisity of Water Resources and Electric Power, 2021). Female leaders are female employees higher than team leaders, and not included in female employees in the figures. Please select plants in the dropdown menu of the top-right of the figure.

children.name: Employee Incomes of Pilot Plants
children.desc: Averaged incomes of employees of the pilot plants before and after refurbishment. Data from monitoring and analysis (Zhejiang Univerisity of Water Resources and Electric Power, 2021). Female leaders are female employees higher than team leaders, and not included in female employees in the figures. Please select plants in the dropdown menu of the top-right of the figure.

children.name: Trainees of Capacity Building Workshops
children.desc: Number of trainees in the training workshops for capacity building.

projPartners.name: Partnership
projPartners.desc: We would also like to express our sincere gratitudes towards individual consultants and experts who took part in the project.

projContact.name: Follow Us
projContact.desc: This page and its linked documents have been produced without formal United Nations editing. The designations employed and the presentation of the material in this document do not imply the expression of any opinion whatsoever on the part of the Secretariat of the United Nations Industrial Development Organization (UNIDO) concerning the legal status of any country, territory, city or area or of its authorities, or concerning the delimitation of its frontiers or boundaries, or its economic system or degree of development. Designations such as “developed”, “industrialized” or “developing” are intended for statistical convenience and do not necessarily express a judgement about the stage reached by a particular country or area in the development process. Mention of firm names or commercial products does not constitute an endorsement by UNIDO. The information provided on this page and in the linked documents is obtained during the execution of the project and is subject to potential changes in validity. The categorisation and presentation of this information should not be interpreted as reflecting any viewpoint, opinion, or position of any government entity or public institution.
